Constructor Detail

Options

public Options()
Method Detail

option

public Options option(java.lang.Character flag,
                      java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.String description,
                      int required_values,
                      java.lang.String... default_values)
Defines an option by adding it to the list of options and returning the options. Short options are identified by a flag character and long options are identified by a naming string. Options can have both a flag and a name but it is an error, if both are undefined. The description for the usage help is required. An option can require one or more arguments and each argument may have a default value.

Parameters:
flag - the character for a short option
name - the long name of the option
description - a short description for the help text
required_values - the number of required option values
default_values - the default values if the option is not specified
Returns:
the option object
Throws:
InvalidOptionException - if flag and name are both null

parse

public java.lang.String[] parse(java.lang.String[] arguments)
Parse the arguments list by extracting the options and returning the remaining arguments. Options are either short or long options. A short option starts with a hyphen followed by a character and zero or more optional argument. The following list shows examples for valid short options.

  • -n
  • -o1
  • -o 1
  • -t 1 2

Long options are starting which two two hyphens followed by a string and further optional arguments. The following list shows examples for valid long options.

  • --help
  • --add 1 2
  • --debug hi

Two hyphens without any name terminate the option list. All options following the termination are returned as remaining arguments.

Parameters:
arguments - the list of command line arguments
Returns:
the list of non option arguments
Throws:
InvalidOptionException

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
